action.action-desc: Mr. Polis introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce, and in addition to the Committee on the Budget, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To authorize the full funding of part B of the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act by making certain spending cuts to the Department of Defense.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Defending Special Education Students and Families Act of 2017.

section.header: Authorization of appropriations for part B of the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act
section.text: Section 611(i) of the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (20 U.S.C. 1411(i)) is amended to read as follows:

subsection.text: For the purpose of carrying out this part, other than section 619, there are authorized to be appropriated—

paragraph.text: for fiscal year 2023 and each subsequent fiscal year—

subparagraph.text: the number of children with disabilities in the prior school year in the States, outlying areas, and freely associated States who received special education and related services—

clause.text: aged 3 through 5 if the States, outlying areas, and freely associated States are eligible for a grant under section 619; and

subparagraph.text: 40 percent of the average per-pupil expenditure in public elementary schools and secondary schools in the United States; adjusted by
the rate of annual change in the sum of 85 percent of such State's, outlying areas, and freely associated State's population described in subsection (d)(3)(A)(i)(II).
